newsitem.title: INDIA: India's Chidambaram sees sharp industrial pickup.
newsitem.headline: India's Chidambaram sees sharp industrial pickup.

text.p: Indian Finance Minister P. Chidambaram said on Saturday that he expects industrial production to pick up sharply in 1997/98 (April-March).
Chidambaram told a news conference in the capital that he did not believe that industrial growth would be weaker in 1997/98 than the previous fiscal year.
"In fact, I think industrial growth will sharply pick up thanks to the bountiful (grains) harvest of 192 million tonnes," he said.
India's index of industrial production increased by 7.0 percent during the period April 1996 to February 1997 compared with the same 11-month stretch in 1995/96.
But the rate of growth slowed substantially in the second half of 1996/97, and in February it was 2.4 percent higher than in the same month in 1996.
